text:
Hi all. I’m trying to call the tracking api’s identify method multiple times, so as to progressively add custom properties to the contact as they are known.

The first time I will send an email and a first name

```_hsq.push(['identify', {
    email: '<mailto:abc@gmail.com|abc@gmail.com>',
    firstname: 'Norman',
}])

_hsq.push(['trackPageView'])```
This code is updating or creating the contact associated with <mailto:abc@gmail.com|abc@gmail.com>

Then, on a second call I’ll send the lastname and phone.

```_hsq.push(['identify', {
    email: '<mailto:abc@gmail.com|abc@gmail.com>',
    firstname: 'Norman',
    lastname: 'Bates',
    phone: '123456789'
}])

_hsq.push(['trackPageView'])```
This time, I’m not seen the new properties updated on the contact record.

Note: Both calls are from the same web session. As you may guess when on a new session this second call will update the properties as I wanted.

Is it impossible to call ‘identify’ more than once so as to progressively update contact’s properties?
Thanks <@U03BA1PRV7S> It sounds like a plan for the future. I still need the historical data tho

How are HubSpot Owners and HubSpot Users different?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/owners>
Yes, you just need to set up a loop to go through all pages
Essentially an owner is a user who is associated to a HubSpot object. They also have different IDs and different APIs.
<@U03BA1PRV7S> thanks for the reply! Appreciate it :pray:
